intro: Tetrastigma lunglingense, commonly known as the Lungling vine, is a climbing plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and tendrils that aid in its climbing habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
